Detailed Description

This class is a group of tasks with a similar function.

It is not a singleton, but there is one global root group.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Constructor.

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

void MainLoopTasks::add ( MainLoopTask *  pTask,
const char *  name,
  ... 
)

Adds the given task to our list of tasks.

The name can contain slashes '/' to place it within the hierarchy of groups.

The variable length arguments are a list of strings (char *s) specifying the sorting rules for this task. The rules are of the form '>TaskA', '<TaskB', meaning that this task should execute after TaskA and before TaskB. The tasks named in rules are only within the innermost group.

The task pointer can be NULL or equal to an already added task, in which case the rules for the named task are rewritten. This is necessary to specify rules for possibly automatically created groups. If the task is NULL but no such task exists, a group task is created as if automatically.

The list of tasks is re-sorted after this call.

void MainLoopTasks::del ( MainLoopTask *  pTask,
const char *  name 
)

Deletes the given task from the list of tasks.

void MainLoopTasks::inactiveTick ( float  dTime  )  [virtual]

Call inactive tick methods in order.

The inactive tick is used to update the client when the application is inactive. Currently this is when the application is minimised.

Reimplemented from MainLoopTask.
